definition: erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: On day Cui Ning went out to work in Xiantan.
sentences.chinese: 一天，崔宁到湘潭市区做活儿。

sentences.english: The pupils are now working in the field.
sentences.chinese: 学生这会儿都在田间做活儿。

sentences.english: Taboo: Saying something unlucky or working in the field.
sentences.chinese: 学生这会儿都在田间做活儿。

definition: erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
needlework/working for a living as a needleworker
to go to work/to start work
to help with farm work/casual laborer
to work for a living (esp. of woman needleworker)/life of a group of stones in Go 圍棋|围棋[wei2 qi2]
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
flying needle and running seam (idiom); skillful needlework
